answers.answer: Yes def im 36+5 and im ready for my son as well this is #2 for me and I have way more pains than with my 1st, even though we don't have long now it seem like its gonna take forever to go into labor. Whenever I have trouble sleeping I usually take 2 Benadryl and I sleep like a baby lol. I hope your lil man arrives soon to put you out of your misery!

I feel the same way it's my back and vaginal area that hurts so bad and just aches and pains I can't take it anymore! I'm only 36 weeks. And want my daughter out, but I know I have to wait it out for her I just am tired of it. Good luck to you both and hope you have your babies soon!!!

@Nicole05- I've tried taking the benadryl but it doesn't work. My doc told me I can take unisom. I tried that also but it knocks me out for 12 hrs so thats outta the question since I have to take care of the other kids. And a half of a unisom doesn't help me sleep at all.Good luck to both y'all and hopefully we get to meet our lil ones soon!
Awww man that *****, Ive heard of unisom but I had no idea it had that type of effect you miss half a day with that lol...happy labor and delivery for you ladies its almost our turn!!!

It does suck but most sleeping pills do that to me. The only thing that doesn't is melatonin but we can't take it while pregnant. I sooo wish I could just once or twice so I can sleep. But soon I'll at least be able to get comfy even if I don't get to sleep all night. Its all worth it in the end

Oh yes, i'm sooooo over it, i'm 38+2 and my stomach truly feels like a big hard round bowling ball, it hurts to even sit, and sleeping at night is very hard, my hips ache from lying one side to another. I really hope i go into labor soon, and don't go overdue, as i feel like i'm about to burst.

@Thirdtimemum- I know exactly what you mean. I try to sleep propped up and have to switch from side to side using a pillow under my belly and my knee. I can barely get up whether I'm sitting or laying down. I'm huge....everyone thought I was due last month. They can't believe that I'm not due til April 22nd. Only having one but I look like I'm carrying twins...

Why do they think you're having a big baby? Do you have GD? I'm really scared of my boy getting too big as well, cause i have it, but cause i pretty much have it under control they're not going to induce me any earlier. Its so hard walking, but i try everyday now to walk around the block, i wanna get things moving! I drink raspberry leaf tea everyday too, but i know that doesn't bring it on, just helps your labor go faster. I feel every day is dragging!!! And i'm not going to drink castor oil or anything, side effects too awful.

No I don't have GD or preeclampsia. I think I just tend to have bigger kids. Out of my other 3, my smallest was 7lbs 14oz, and he was my first. I also broke the right collar bone on all 3 kids during delivery. I'm hoping that I don't with this lil man. I've had all of them vaginally w/o having epidural. Gona try for the same thing this time. Since doc gave me the ok on Wednesday to start walking & stuff, I have done plenty of it to try to get things moving along. Just gonna try not to overdue it too much so I can at least make it til Monday so I'm considered full term

At my last u/s 36w bub weighed 5lb 9oz, so am expecting him to be about maybe 7lb if i go the full 40? This is the furtherest i've been in my pregnancies, my first daughter was 33w c section, 4lb, and my son was 38w induced, 4lb 14oz. This pregnancy they say everything is fine (apart from GD) and they're just leaving me go! I'm really feeling it this time, and i can't imagine going past my due date, i think i'll go insane. I'm also going to ask for an epidural this time if the pain is as bad as it was with my last son, i literally screamed the hospital down and lost my voice the next day!

I know what you mean. I'm really hoping to go earlycuz if I go to 40wks they're expecting this one to be abt 9lbs. Both my last 2 went to 40 wks & they both wieghed over 8lbs. My oldest was born at 38+4. I don't know if you know that if your baby decides to roll over during labor & the cord is around their neck, it makes the contractions feel a whole lot stronger than they actually are.

No, i didn't know that, but i think my last labor was more intense because i got induced, alot of people have said to me going natural wasn't as full on as induced labor is. I don't know, because i've never tried it! So this pregnancy is the first time i've had to just sit back and play the waiting game. Which is good, because i always wanted to try it this way, but it's been 10 years between children, and i'd forgotten just how bad it is towards the end. I hope i'm like you with your eldest, and go at 38+4! Was that natural?

My doc had to break my water for him but no meds or anything with him. It was the same way with my daughter. With my youngest so, they had to induce me, break my water and give me pain meds. They induced cuz on my due date I went in for my check up and his heartbeat was really high; had to break my water cuz I wasn't progressing enough after induction. But needed pain meds cuz he kept turning & wrapping cord around his neck and it kept getting tighter. The contractions were measuring 3 on the monitor but felt like a 10. He ended up in nicu for abt 3wks cuz of rapid heartbeat, head being black from cord being wrapped around his neck 2 times and extremely tight, and having jaundice to where he needed to be put under the lights to cure it. He was on heart meds for 18 months but is now off them and very healthy. You wouldn't know he was born with a heart condition by looking at him. Even thoughhe has outgrown the heart condition, it can come back at any time so I still worry all the time

question: Well, I'm 36+4 and went for my 4th u/s today. My lil man is measuring at abt 38+4 and weighs abt 7lbs...I can't sleep most of the time, always hurting, and my morning sickness is back! This is my 4th child and it has been completely different from the other 3. I'm so ready to have my boy here with me. Doc finally gave me the ok to start walking again after tellin me not to due to having so much back pain and him not wanting me to throw my back out....I know its still a lil early to try to induce naturally but I'm gonna start walking & hope it helps. Anyone else feel the same way?
title: So ready to have this lil boy...
